Guitarists By Whom I Have Been Intruiged

These are in no particular order, although Curt Kirkwood and D. Boon are indeed my two most favoritest.

In the case of some of them, I only listed the bands in which I was “into” them; for example, I loved Brian Baker in Minor Threat and Dag Nasty, but I’ve never heard his stuff in Bad Religion

  1. Curt Kirkwood
  2. D. Boon
  3. Nels Cline
  4. Deke Dickerson
  5. Dr. Know
  6. Joe Baiza
  7. Eddie Van Halen
  8. Jimmy Page
  9. Jimi Hendrix
  10. Mark Knopfler
  11. Tom Verlaine
  12. Johnny Ramone
  13. Chuck Berry
  14. Ralph Spight (Victims Family)
  15. Eddie Roberts (New Mastersounds)
  16. Bryan Giles (Red Fang)
  17. Brian May
  18. Nile Rodgers
  19. Rocky George (Suicidal Tendencies)
  20. Scott Hill (Fu Manchu)
  21. Bucky Pope (Tar Babies)
  22. Ty Segall
  23. Eddie Roeser (Urge Overkill)
  24. John Kimbrough (Walt Mink)
  25. Dean Ween
  26. Gary Chester (Ed Hall)
  27. James Petralli (White Denim)
  28. Tommy Niemeyer (The Accüsed)
  29. Alex Lifeson
  30. Jack Endino
  31. Johnny Marr
  32. Andy Kerr (NoMeansNo)
  33. Rick Miller (Southern Culture on the Skids)
  34. Steve Turner (Mudhoney)
  35. Larry LaLonde
  36. East Bay Ray (Dead Kennedys)
  37. Peter Frampton
  38. Alan Anderson (PopDefect)
  39. Tom Pig (Poison Idea)
  40. Gavin MacArthur (Schlong)
  41. Duane Denison (Jesus Lizard)
  42. Angus Young
  43. Ian Williams (Don Caballero)
  44. J Mascis
  45. Jon Fine (Bitch Magnet)
  46. Brad Paisley
  47. Charlie Hunter
  48. Cory Wong
  49. Dexter Romweber (Flat Duo Jets)
  50. Dave Navarro
  51. J Robbins (Jawbox)
  52. Berton Averre (The Knack)

  54. Jack White

  56. Billy Duffy

  58. Josh Homme

  60. Captain Sensible (Damned)
  61. Dave Diebler (House of Large Sizes)
